SENT.plain: We investigated the efficacy of arsenic trioxide (ATO) in patients with refractory severe aplastic anemia (SAA)
A total of 5 consecutive adults were enrolled
The patients received ATO at a dose of 0.15 mg/kg intravenously daily for 5 days every week for 8 weeks
If necessary, a second course was performed after an interval of one week
All patients achieved clinically significant responses to ATO
The overall complete response rate and overall response rate at 17 weeks were 60% (3/5) and 100%(5/5), respectively
So treatment with ATO may be a feasible approach in patients with refractory SAA
